channel.title: Airsoft!
channel.description:
Airsoft lovers post what ever you'd like to about airsoft here! Weather it about discussing guns, equipment, guns to buy, or anything!
I'd like to start it off.
There are 4 guns I'm deciding between: The A&K M43MOD0/M60, A&K SR-25 URX, Classic Army SL8(NEW ONE), and finally, the DBOYS FN SCAR. Anyone know the best one? I'm deciding on the URX anyways. Also, I've got a WE Hi-Capa 5.1 Silver Dragon, UTG L96, TM Desert Eagle and SOON, the Well G55/MP5K. I'm also gonig to get a ACU pattern BDU(Battle Dress Uniform) along with an OE TECH Tactical Vest, Mechanix Wear M-Pact Glove ( Black / X-Large ), some ACU Knee and Elbow pads, Arena FlakJak Goggles (TAN), and maybe some other random crap. Also, if i DO get the SR25 which i just may, I'm going to get an AMP Special Force Red/Green Crosshair Scope, Guarder Ergonomic Vertical Tactical Foregrip (BK), and a SHITLOAD of .25g BB's. So yeah, post anything you'd like about airsoft here! ^_^

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: Yomomasface
item.description:
Vertigo One:

Former lurker here. Finally decided to register.

I have a CA mp5 sd5, with a hi-cap mag. Excellent gun, and shoots hard, far and fast. Not too impressive in regards to accuracy though.

Anyone have any recommendations as to the best gas-pistols?

If i were you, I’d go with a WE 5.1 Hi-Capa Dragon. Well, preferable one with a Striker head. I personally have a 5.1 Dragon and it’s lasted forever! Shoot’s at a perfect 330FPS too. :3

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
Vertigo One:

About 15 pounds or so.

Edit: Just weighed it, actually about 11 pounds. Sorry guys, too lazy to convert it to kilos. :b

2.2lbs to a kilo, so that’s about exactly 5.

Vertigo One:

About 15 pounds or so.

Considering the real MP5SD weighs around 3 kilos, it HAS to be mainly metal

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: Vertigo_One
item.description:
The_Assassin47:

The man with the biggest gun always wins.
When we compete, its always everyone look for the enemy sniper, and take him out first. Most often though we’ll kill everyone else and only the sniper will be left. And it takes along time if ever to get em down. (Though some smoke grenades in his vicinity work very well!)
If it really is CA, I would be very surprised if it weren’t all metal. What’s it weigh?

About 15 pounds or so.

Edit: Just weighed it, actually about 11 pounds. Sorry guys, too lazy to convert it to kilos. :b

Read full topic

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: The_Assassin47
item.description:
The man with the biggest gun always wins.
When we compete, its always everyone look for the enemy sniper, and take him out first. Most often though we’ll kill everyone else and only the sniper will be left. And it takes along time if ever to get em down. (Though some smoke grenades in his vicinity work very well!)
If it really is CA, I would be very surprised if it weren’t all metal. What’s it weigh?

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: Vertigo_One
item.description:
BerZerK:

Doesnt seem to be that expensive, if the quality matches the price compared to other products with the same features.

I assume it has a metal gearbox?

I think it’s mostly metal.

The upgrade I had them put in for me included a heavier duty one I believe. If I hadn’t upgraded the gun, I can safely say I feel it wouldnt have been worth the money. But once it’s upgraded, that gun easily rivals some of the more expensive guns out there.

I had a cheapo mostly hard plastic mp5 by some off brand before I got it, and I would usually get 1 or 2 kills for every day airsofting (which is usually about 3 or 4 games). The first time I took this gun out, I got 11 kills in the first game and 8 kills the second, before the fuse blew

Such is airsofting I suppose.

Read full topic

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: BerZerK
item.description:
Vertigo One:

Thank you for the welcome!

I spent about $400 on the gun itself, and $100 on a spring upgrade and 10.8 V battery, so about $500 total.

Quite a bit of money, but I feel I’ve gotten good use out of it, and try to go airsofting at least once a month.

EDIT: the extra $100 also included a laser sight scope

Doesnt seem to be that expensive, if the quality matches the price compared to other products with the same features.

I assume it has a metal gearbox?

Read full topic

Welcome, my common “former lurker”

Never had a gas-pistol, just a normal manual spring Colt 1911, so can’t really recommend anything.

I’m curious about that MP5 of yours though, do you recall what you paid for it?

Thank you for the welcome!

I spent about $400 on the gun itself, and $100 on a spring upgrade and 10.8 V battery, so about $500 total.

Quite a bit of money, but I feel I’ve gotten good use out of it, and try to go airsofting at least once a month.

EDIT: the extra $100 also included a laser sight scope

ICS is one of the top top top brands of airsfot equipment. Along with Classic Army and Tokyo Marui.

Read full topic

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: BerZerK
item.description:
Yomomasface:

Haha, you can never go wrong with a MP5! XD For the price, go with an ICS MP5. I’ve owned a few, ICS is the best out there. Classic Army can’t even COMPETE to ICS. Especially externally. For a nice sidearm, you might want to look into getting a Well G55/MP5, gas blowback goodness! 2,000 rounds per frekkin minute too!

I’ve pretty much decided to go for an electric MP5, but was thinking about using a Clock 18 or 19 (gas blowback) as a sidearm. I cant recall hearing of ICS, but if you have had good experiences with their softguns I’ll try them out perhaps.

Buying softguns domestic isnt a very cheap alternative, I was thinking about ordering from Japan, but don’t know of any companies that ship to Europe. I’ll have to look around some more.

Read full topic

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
[COLOR=‘Red’]Posts deleted, infractions issued.

That said, Yomomasface, stop whining. You’re spending more time whining about other people than you are saying anything on-topic yourself. I’ll handle the moderation, thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Airsoft!
item.dc:creator: Yomomasface
item.description:
BerZerK:

I’m glad someone made a thread about Airsoft’s. I got one myself, although it’s a cheap MP5SD. Don’t even have a hi-cap magazine

What the hell is with all the hating? Someone likes airsoft, someone doesnt. If you dont, nobody is forcing you to use this thread for useless trolling.
So people like Kaza and Ramirezoid, please keep your fingers of the keyboard for this thread.

Anyway, I’ve been thinking of buying an new MP5 or MP5K with metal gearbox, but I keep wondering to order from Japan to save some dough. Any tips?

And for the trolls, this isnt just a sport for nerds/geeks etc. Myself, I’m a 19 year old Sergeant in the Royal Norwegian Air Force. I’m not showing of my rank or anything, just showing an example of the point.

Haha, you can never go wrong with a MP5! XD For the price, go with an ICS MP5. I’ve owned a few, ICS is the best out there. Classic Army can’t even COMPETE to ICS. Especially externally. For a nice sidearm, you might want to look into getting a Well G55/MP5, gas blowback goodness! 2,000 rounds per frekkin minute too! And yes, why can’t people accept we like airsoft? I know Kaze has fun with his past times, why can’t we? Becasue they’re ours. Jeez, people, shut up already. All the trolling and whining is doing is showing your immaturity. And nice point at the end man. I’ve never even seen a Geek out in the field playing airsoft. Nor do i expect to call them that because we all like different stuff. So yeah, troll’s, please go away.

Read full topic
